embeds.title: Arms Theft
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 2 :e_gremlin: / The Gremlins / Downfall

**Steal** 1 (2) **Strength** :p_strength:.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content:
I have Disarm...
I have Inflame...
UGH!
Arms Theft!!!
that should be enough to tell you that this is a very good card
unupgraded is meh tho
and grems tend to have energy problems a fair amount
i wouldn’t pick it before getting 4th energy
it is strange they only give you half a disarm and half an inflame for full price
also i don’t think i ever saw it naturally upgraded so far so i never really picked it
Ya 2 energy is a lot
Considering gremlins don't have to deal with the heart I often times feel like strength reduction isn't all than necessary
Especially since a lot of the bosses have artifacts or strength gain as thier mechanic
strength reduction will still slow down strength-gaining bosses
especially silent 3
For whatever reason my brain thinks the card is a power
I dunno why
this card is pretty good, gremlins can easily afford 2 energy cards and even just 1 strength can go a long way when your using shivs and multi hit cards.
this ends up being one of the main snecko eye cards too; which is a relic thats really strong for gremlins
Opinions seem pretty split on this one
its worse Orbwalk attached to Flash Powder with no block
i dont like it
hm, it's almost as if half the people stole the positive opinions from the other half...
:watcherthink:
you can do so much with 2 energy on gremlins, 2 strength is worth it for me IMO
and the strength down is just a bonus
does this mean you like it or not, I'm confused

I love the flavor of this card, it fits gremlins perfectly. In theory, the effects you are getting are pretty solid as well, considering the number of cheap spammy attacks that gremlins have (shivs too) as well as how good strength reduction is against multihits. However, I have been very disappointed by this card whenever I take it. It's just so much more expensive than disarm, while reducing less strength, both normally and upgraded. And the strength reduction is the real draw in my opinion, since gremlins very rarely have a problem with scaling up their damage between mad gremlins passive (and artifact sources that can help keep the strength), wiz, polish, target wounds, shadow shiv, second volley, and their already generally high damage output from cheap card spam. I just don't think you are getting a good deal paying 2 energy to get 1/2 strength when you consider the other ways gremlins can deal heavy damage.

My problem with this card is that you are paying for both parts of it, whether you need them or not. Disarm is good because it's an efficient way to scale down multi hitting enemies and mitigate damage throughout the fight. In downfall, the most important multi hitting enemy (the heart) is gone, and so are several other key enemies that use multi hits (spear, awakened one, time eater, champ, guardian, hexaghost). Sure, enemies like silent 3 play lots of cheap attacks, but I think that strength reduction is a little worse overall. There will also be turns/fights where you like one of the effects (scaling/mitigation), but it just feels too expensive because you don't need the other effect. 

It does poorly in both acts 1 and 2, gremlin nob and tri-sentries destroy this card, most early hallway fights aren't long enough to warrant spending 2 energy on scaling and need faster cards than this. It can be helpful into the act 1 boss, since you won't have a ton of time to find scaling. Act 2 hallway fights are too brutal to spend 2 energy on this.
i dont like it, but i can see it's usecase
grems have so much scaling and damage increasing built-in to the character, and 2 cost 2 strength is just plain awful compared to a <polish> or similar

embeds.title: Polish
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :e_gremlin: / The Gremlins / Downfall

Shivs deal 2 (3) additional damage.
Wards grant 2 (3) additional **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: The act 2 hallways deal too much damage to get away with spending 2 energy on scaling with little front-loaded impact. It's not bad against book of stabbing, but this is way too slow for both tri slavers and gremlin leader. Taking it in act 3/4 is more reasonable, but you have probably found a cleaner/more efficient scaling solution by then. The upgrade is great, but it's effectively required to even play the card. Stealing just 1 strength (especially if the enemy still has artifact charges) is very low impact for 2 energy. I would almost never take arms theft unupgraded, or without a campfire coming up soon to upgrade it and make it stronger. I think it could use a buff of some kind, but there isn't much you could change without breaking it, maybe let it cost 1 less if you meet a certain requirement? Maybe it costs 1 less if you have a shiv in your hand? The main problem is that you don't always want both of these effects, but there's no way to pay for just one of them.
maybe it could become a base 2 cost steal 2, and the upgrade making it give plated armor/metallicize?
So the card from packmaster's thief pack?
wait no its combining 2 of those.
